github.title: GitHub Integration
github.subtitle: Configure GitHub API access for the GitHub Activity card
github.fineGrainedInstructions: Set expiration, select 'Public repositories (read-only)'. No additional permissions needed for public repos.
github.classicInstructions: No scopes needed for public repos. For private repos, check the 'repo' scope.
github.securityWarning: Token is stored in browser localStorage (not encrypted). Use a token with minimal permissions and set an expiration date.

predictions.title: Predictive Failure Detection
predictions.subtitle: Configure AI-powered prediction settings
predictions.aiPredictionsDesc: Analyze cluster data with AI to detect patterns
predictions.analysisIntervalDesc: How often AI analyzes cluster data. Lower = more API calls.
predictions.minConfidenceDesc: Only show predictions with confidence above this threshold.
predictions.multiProviderDesc: Run analysis on multiple AI providers, boost confidence when they agree
predictions.heuristicThresholdsDesc: These thresholds trigger instant predictions without AI analysis.

notifications.title: Alert Notifications
notifications.subtitle: Configure notification channels
notifications.description: Configure notification channels for alert delivery. Alerts will be sent to all enabled channels.

slack.title: Slack Integration
slack.webhookHint: Create a webhook in your Slack workspace settings
slack.channelHint: Override the default channel configured in webhook
slack.configureFirst: Please configure Slack webhook URL first

email.title: Email Integration
email.configureFirst: Please configure all required email fields first

notifications.tip: Configure notification channels here, then add them to specific alert rules in the Alert Rules editor. Each rule can have multiple notification channels with different configurations.

persistence.title: Deploy Persistence
persistence.subtitle: Store workloads, groups, and deployments as Kubernetes CRs
persistence.enableDesc: Store Deploy dashboard state as Custom Resources
persistence.failoverDesc: Failover to secondary cluster if primary is unavailable
persistence.namespaceHint: Namespace where console CRs will be stored
persistence.kubectlHint: When enabled, you can use kubectl to manage workloads, groups, and deployments. Changes made via kubectl will automatically sync to the UI.

localClusters.title: Local Clusters
localClusters.subtitle: Create and manage local Kubernetes clusters
localClusters.connectAgent: Connect the local agent to manage local clusters
localClusters.agentDesc: The local agent can detect and manage kind, k3d, and minikube clusters on your machine.
localClusters.installTools: Install one of these tools to create local clusters:
localClusters.noClusters: No local clusters found. Create one above to get started.
localClusters.deleteConfirm: Delete cluster "{{name}}"? This cannot be undone.

backup.title: Backup & Sync
backup.subtitle: Settings persisted to disk — survives cache clears and upgrades
backup.importFailed: Failed to import settings. Check that the file is a valid backup.
backup.securityNote: API keys, tokens, and credentials are AES-256-GCM encrypted at rest. Non-sensitive preferences (theme, AI mode) are stored in plaintext for easy reading. Exported backups retain encryption — they can only be imported on machines with the same encryption key.

widget.title: Desktop Widget
widget.subtitle: Monitor clusters from your desktop
widget.browserWidgetDesc: Open in any browser. Use Safari PiP or Chrome Always-on-Top.
widget.ubersichtWidgetDesc: Native macOS desktop widget. Draggable and always visible.
widget.chromeHint: Chrome/Edge: Install an 'Always on Top' extension, then pin the widget tab.
widget.safariHint: Safari: Right-click the tab → 'Enter Picture in Picture' for a floating widget.
widget.step3: Ensure kc-agent is running on port 8585
widget.previewDesc: Draggable · Click stats to open console · Auto-refreshes every 30s
widget.selectWidget: Select a widget type above to see installation options

updates.title: System Updates

updates.webConsoleDesc: Refresh your browser to load the latest version.
updates.localAgentDesc: Update via Homebrew to get the latest agent features.
updates.clusterDeploymentDesc: Update your Helm release to the latest chart version.

gitops.subtitle: GitOps drift detection and sync status
gitops.dashboardDescription: Add cards to monitor ArgoCD applications, Helm releases, and GitOps sync status.
gitops.integrationDescription: GitOps integration detects drift between your Git repository and live cluster state using kubectl diff. Connect ArgoCD or Flux for enhanced sync capabilities.

welcome.subtitle: You're up and running — just a few optional steps left
welcome.step1Desc: Your KubeStellar Console is up and ready.
welcome.step2Desc: Clusters are auto-detected from your kubeconfig. Place a kubeconfig at ~/.kube/config or configure via Settings.
welcome.step3Desc: Add API keys for Anthropic, OpenAI, or Google to enable AI-powered predictions and card suggestions.

missions.repairTitle: AI Repair - automatically fix this issue

missions.title: Title
missions.titlePlaceholder: e.g., Fix OOM in payment service
missions.problemSolutionPlaceholder: Describe the problem and how it was fixed...

reset.title: Reset Dashboard
reset.description: Choose how to reset your dashboard cards
reset.addMissingDesc: Keep your current cards and add any default cards that are missing. Your customizations will be preserved.
reset.replaceAllDesc: Remove all current cards and replace them with the default set. This will remove any customizations.

create.description: Name your dashboard and optionally start with a template.

demoData.description_other: {{count}} cards displaying simulated data. Connect to live clusters for real data.

configure.title: Configure Card
configure.noSettings: This card type has no additional settings. Check the Behaviors tab.
configure.noBehaviors: This card type has no configurable behaviors
configure.aiConfigDescription: Describe how you want this card to behave in plain English. For example: "Only show warning events and alert me when new ones appear" or "Prioritize unhealthy clusters and refresh faster"
configure.aiPlaceholder: e.g., 'Show me only warning events from the vllm-d cluster and play a sound when new ones appear'
configure.pressEnterHint: Press Enter to apply, Shift+Enter for new line

replace.title: Replace Card
replace.aiCreationDescription: Describe what you want to see and we'll create the perfect card for you.
replace.whatToTrack: What do you want to track or monitor?
replace.aiPlaceholder: e.g., 'Show me pods that have restarted more than 5 times in the last hour'

cardFactory.useDeclarativeOrCode: Use the Declarative or Code tab to create your first card.

missionChat.saveResolutionPrompt: Great! Would you like to save this resolution? It'll help you (and your team) solve similar issues faster next time.
missionChat.thanksFeedback: Thanks for the feedback. Try a different approach or switch to another agent above.

feedback.title: Title
feedback.loginExplanation: Please login with GitHub to submit feedback, request updates, or close requests.
feedback.loginDemoExplanation: This is a public demo — GitHub login requires your own KubeStellar Console instance. Install locally to submit feedback and unlock all features.
feedback.oauthExplanation: To submit feedback and earn coins through the console, you need a GitHub OAuth app configured for your installation.
feedback.oauthStep1: Set up a GitHub OAuth app for your console (~2 minutes)
feedback.oauthStep2: Submit bugs and feature requests directly from the console
feedback.oauthStep3: Earn coins for each submission — our AI works on fixes automatically
feedback.githubIssuesInfo: You can open issues and requests directly on the kubestellar/console GitHub repo. Coins earned from GitHub issues will appear in your console once you configure OAuth.
feedback.alreadySetUp: Already have OAuth configured? Login with GitHub →
feedback.submitFailed: Unable to submit — GitHub login may be required.
feedback.submitFailedGuidance: You can open issues directly on GitHub. Coins will be accumulated and available in your console once you install a GitHub OAuth app.
feedback.submitInfo: Your request will be reviewed by a maintainer before being analyzed by our AI. Once approved, the AI will attempt to create a fix automatically and you'll receive a notification when ready.
feedback.loginBannerDemo: Login with GitHub to submit feedback and manage requests
feedback.loginBannerLocal: Set up GitHub OAuth to submit feedback, earn coins, and track requests

onboarding.installSubtitle: Up and running in under a minute
